alert.note: Alert for Howard (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 3:35PM CST until February 11 at 11:15AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southwest Arkansas, Hempstead, Howard, Little River and Sevier. In southeast Oklahoma, McCurtain. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 335 PM CST, emergency management reported flooding in Holly Creek near Dierks, Messer Creek south of Dierks, and Dry Creek near Watson. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... De Queen, Nashville, Dierks, Horatio, Foreman, Umpire, Idabel, Broken Bow, Lockesburg, Winthrop, Gillham, Ben Lomond, Corinth, Arkinda, Athens, Center Point, Wright City, Valliant, Oak Grove and Millerton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
